Definition.Document:
Manufacturing OEE 

The Challenge

Combining, contextualizing, and taking action on disparate and dense data to optimized throughput.

The Impact

A top 5 pharmaceutical company used Seeq to monitor Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE) finding $65M/year in additional production revenue.

The Solution 

Overall Equipment Effectiveness is a commonly used method to identify the top downtime, performance loss, and quality loss reasons. With Seeq OEE, inefficiencies are easily identified and improvement plans can begin immediately in real-time.

Connect to Datasources

Bring together data from various datasources, independent of interpolation or data types. 

  • Add Data

Identify and Contextualize

Availability

Identify  periods of downtime from the raw data. Seeq has the flexibility to handle different signal input types.

  • Line 1 - Machine Status Signal

Contextualize the downtime by assigning a reason. Use data from multiple sources to assign reasons automatically.

  • Numerical Codes > Reason Assignment (Line 1)
  • Downtime

Any Downtime events without automatic reason codes are sent to the Manual Input Tool for operations personnel to quickly and easily assign reasons. 

  • Manual Assignment --> Chain
    • OEE Add-on

Specify the "lowest repeatable time" for the planned downtime and use to identify unplanned.

  • Downtime Breakdown

Using the downtime breakdown along with the expected lowest repeatable time for planned downtime, the operational availability is determined.

  • OA

Performance

Most manufacturing processes have an max speed at which products should be produced. Quantify losses from performance issues from actual vs expected.

  • Speed Loss

Quality

Quality loss represents the products that are defective and scrapped during production. 

  • Quality Loss

Note that, in some organizations the standard OEE calculation will not be the most useful metric. The same method described can be used to create alternative metrics such as OA (Operational Availability).

Report

Use different visualization options to report, analyze and improve the OEE metrics.

  • Line View
  • Factory Daily OEE Table
  • Daily Downtime Table View
  • Treemap Live View
  • PowerBI

Manufacturing OEE 

The Challenge

Combining, contextualizing, and taking action on disparate and dense data to optimized throughput.

The Impact

A top 5 pharmaceutical company used Seeq to monitor Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE) finding $65M/year in additional production revenue.

The Solution 

Overall Equipment Effectiveness is a commonly used method to identify the top downtime, performance loss, and quality loss reasons. With Seeq OEE, inefficiencies are easily identified and improvement plans can begin immediately in real-time.

  • Line 1 - Machine Status Signal

Contextualize the downtime by assigning a reason. Use data from multiple sources to assign reasons automatically.

  • Numerical Codes > Reason Assignment (Line 1)
  •  

Any Downtime events without automatic reason codes are sent to the Manual Input Tool for operations personnel to quickly and easily assign reasons. 

  • Manual Assignment --> Chain
    • OEE Add-on

Specify the "lowest repeatable time" for the planned downtime and use to identify unplanned.

  • Downtime Breakdown

Using the downtime breakdown along with the expected lowest repeatable time for planned downtime, the operational down is determined.

  • OA

Performance

Most manufacturing processes have an max speed at which products should be produced. Quantify losses from performance issues from actual vs expected.

  • Speed Loss

Quality

Quality loss represents the products that are defective and scrapped during production. 

  • Quality Loss

Note that, in some organizations the standard OEE calculation will not be the most useful metric. The same method described can be used to create alternative metrics such as OA (Operational Availability).

Definition.Froala Backup:
The Challenge

TO DO: some facts about average machine OEE (~40%), and how much $$$ is lost though inefficiencys and why its important for sustainability

The Solution

Final View

Overall Equiptment Effectiveness is a commonly used method to identify the top downtime, performance loss, and quality loss reasons. With Seeq OEE, inefficiencies are easily identified and improvement plans can begin immediately, and seamlessly on the same user-friendly analytics platform.

The Impact

A top 5 pharmaceutical company used Seeq to monitor Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE) finding $65M/year in additional production revenue.

TO DO: add public customer logos

Method: 

Reset

1. Connect to Datasources

Add Data

2. Identify and Contextualize

Availability

A) Identify periods of downtime from the raw data. Seeq has the flexibility to handle different signal input types.

  • Line 1 - Machine Running Signal

B) Contextualize the downtime by assigning a reason. Use data from multiple sources to assign reasons automatically;

  • Numerical Codes > Reason Codes (Line 1)

Any downtime events without reasons assigned  are sent to the Manual Input Tool for operations personnel to quickly and easily assign reasons. Sharing Insights in near real-time.

Add-on: OEE Manual Input 

C) Cleanse

Specify the "lowest repeatable time" in which the planned stop should be completed, and any excess time will be categorised as an unplanned stop. 

Finally, we now have an accurate calculation of the equipment availability.

Performance

Most manufacturing proccesses have an ideal speed at which products should be produced. Use aggregration tools to quantify losses from performance issues.

Live Monitoring

Quality

 Quality loss represents the products that are defective and scrapped during production. 

Quality Metric

Note that, in some organizations the standard OEE calculation will not be the most useful metric. The same method described can be used to create altenative metrics such as OA (Operational Availability).

3. Report

Use different visualization options to report, analyze and improve the OEE metrics.

  • Line 1 View
  • Factory Daily OEE Table
  • Daily Downtime Table View
  • Treemap Live View

The breakdown of OEE information can also be summarized in an interactive, auto-updating dashboard via a BI tool such as PowerBI. See the next worksheet for more information on how to use OData to feed data to a BI tool. 

View Key Results in Organizer / Power BI

Or, create a report in TO DO: Organizer (either a separate OEE one or just part of a bigger demo one).

4. Improve

The biggest value from OEE is using data captured to drive improvement plans. See our demos on root cause analysis, preventative and predictive maintenance, and other advanced analytics topics for more information!
